DOC.brief_summary: Many people with type 2 diabetes cannot maintain target blood glucose levels when taking a single oral drug. The purpose of this study is to assess the long term safety and effectiveness of vildagliptin, an unapproved drug, compared to that of glimepiride in lowering overall blood glucose levels when added to metformin in people with type 2 diabetes not at target blood glucose levels on metformin alone.
DOC.brief_title: Vildagliptin Compared to Glimepiride in Combination With Metformin in Patients With Type 2 Diabetes
DOC.criteria: On a stable dose of metformin as defined by the protocol Body mass index (BMI) in the range 2245 Blood glucose criteria must be met Pregnancy or lactation Type 1 diabetes Evidence of significant diabetic complications Evidence of serious cardiovascular complications Laboratory value abnormalities as defined by the protocol Other protocoldefined exclusion criteria may apply
